Comment: Yeah--and I think the key thing to understand is that most of these universities were *already* quietly giving free tuition to the vast majority of low-income students, and have been for a while. It just wasn't public. Eventually they realized that if they publicized that info and made it into an official guarantee, it would mean that more students would apply. There were a lot of low-income students who had the ability to get in but didn't bother to apply because they didn't think they could afford it.  So the change wasn't really that the universities are spending substantially more, it's just that they're publicizing the spending they were already doing.
